passage: In a recent study on bridge design, researchers discovered that using lightweight materials can significantly reduce construction time. They analyzed two similar bridges: one built with traditional materials and the other with lightweight materials. Both bridges had the same structural integrity and load-bearing capacity.
question: Which finding, if true, would most strongly support the researchers' claim regarding the advantages of lightweight materials in bridge construction?

choices.A: The bridge built with lightweight materials was completed 30% faster than the one built with traditional materials.
choices.B: The bridge built with traditional materials required more maintenance over time compared to the one built with lightweight materials.
choices.C: A survey of local residents revealed a preference for the aesthetics of the bridge built with lightweight materials.
choices.D: The bridge built with lightweight materials was able to withstand a higher wind load than the one built with traditional materials.

explanation: A: 'The bridge built with lightweight materials was completed 30% faster than the one built with traditional materials.' is the correct answer because it directly supports the researchers' claim that using lightweight materials can significantly reduce construction time.
distractor_explanation: 'The bridge built with traditional materials required more maintenance over time compared to the one built with lightweight materials.' is incorrect because it does not directly address the construction time of the bridges.
'A survey of local residents revealed a preference for the aesthetics of the bridge built with lightweight materials.' is incorrect because it is unrelated to the construction time of the bridges.

'The bridge built with lightweight materials was able to withstand a higher wind load than the one built with traditional materials.' is incorrect because it does not directly address the construction time of the bridges.
